article.text: Government Commissioner to the Military Court Judge Saqr Saqr began interrogating the army members who were present at the check point where Sunni cleric Ahmad Abdel Wahed was killed, the army command said in a statement on Sunday. “Saqr headed to North [Lebanon] where he checked the scene of the incident and looked at the evidence. He also began investigation alongside army members [who were present at the checkpoint] in order to reveal the circumstances of the incident and employ the [appropriate] legal procedure,” the statement added. Army troops shot dead Sheikh Abdel Wahed on Sunday when his convoy failed to stop at a checkpoint in North Lebanon, the scene of deadly clashes linked to the uprising in Syria, a security official said according to AFP. The sheikh’s bodyguard, Mohammad Hussein Merheb, was also killed.-NOW Lebanon
